tool.name: ExportToSpreadsheet
tool.description: export measurements into one or more files

param.name: metadata_category
param.label: Select the metadata to use as the identifier

param.name: metadata_measurement
param.label: Measurements
param.help: Choose the measurement that corresponds to the identifier, such as metadata from the Metadata tool. Please see the Metadata tool for more details on metadata collection and usage.

configfiles.configfile:
import json import sys import os
FOURSPACES=@SPACES@
input_json_path = sys.argv[1] input_pipeline= sys.argv[2]
params = json.load(open(input_json_path, "r"))
def write_etss(): _str = "
ExportToSpreadsheet:[module_num:%d|svn_version:\'Unknown\'|variable_revision_number:12|show_window:True|notes:\x5B\x5D|batch_state:array(\x5B\x5D, dtype=uint8)|enabled:True|wants_pause:False]
" % new_count _str += FOURSPACES + "Select the column delimiter:%s
" % params["delimiter"] _str += FOURSPACES + "Add image metadata columns to your object data file?:%s
" % params["add_metadata_column_to_object"]
_str += FOURSPACES + "Select the measurements to export:No
" _str += FOURSPACES + "Calculate the per-image mean values for object measurements?:%s
" % params['calc_mean'] _str += FOURSPACES + "Calculate the per-image median values for object measurements?:%s
" % params['calc_median'] _str += FOURSPACES + "Calculate the per-image standard deviation values for object measurements?:%s
" % params['calc_standard_deviation'] _str += FOURSPACES + "Output file location:Default Output Folder\x7C
"
create_gene = params["con_create_gene_pattern"]["create_gene_pattern"] _str += FOURSPACES + "Create a GenePattern GCT file?:%s
" % create_gene
#default values when create gene is no source_sample_row = "Metadata" image_as_id = "None" metadata_as_id = "None"
if create_gene == "Yes": source_sample_row = params["con_create_gene_pattern"]["con_source_sample_row"]["select_source_sample_row_name"] if source_sample_row == "Metadata": metadata_as_id = params["con_create_gene_pattern"]["con_source_sample_row"]["metadata_category"] + "_" + params["con_create_gene_pattern"]["con_source_sample_row"]["metadata_measurement"] else: image_as_id = params["con_create_gene_pattern"]["con_source_sample_row"]["image_filename_cat"]
_str += FOURSPACES + "Select source of sample row name:%s
" % source_sample_row _str += FOURSPACES + "Select the image to use as the identifier:%s
" % image_as_id _str += FOURSPACES + "Select the metadata to use as the identifier:%s
" % metadata_as_id
export_all_measurements = params["con_export_all_measurements"]["export_all_measurements"]
_str += FOURSPACES + "Export all measurement types?:%s
" % export_all_measurements
_str += FOURSPACES + "Press button to select measurements:
"
_str += FOURSPACES + "Representation of Nan/Inf:%s
" % params["represent_nan"] _str += FOURSPACES + "Add a prefix to file names?:%s
" % params["con_prefix"]["add_prefix"]
if "filename_prefix" in params["con_prefix"]: _str += FOURSPACES + "Filename prefix:%s
" % params["con_prefix"]["filename_prefix"] else: _str += FOURSPACES + "Filename prefix:MyPrefix_
"
_str += FOURSPACES + "Overwrite existing files without warning?:%s
" % params["overwrite_existing_file"]
use_as_filename = "Yes"
if export_all_measurements == "Yes": _str += FOURSPACES + "Data to export:Do not use
" _str += FOURSPACES + "Combine these object measurements with those of the previous object?:No
" _str += FOURSPACES + "File name:DATA.csv
" _str += FOURSPACES + "Use the object name for the file name?:Yes
" else: for dte in params["con_export_all_measurements"]["r_data_to_export"]: _str += FOURSPACES + "Data to export:%s
" % dte["data_to_export"] _str += FOURSPACES + "Combine these object measurements with those of the previous object?:No
"
use_as_filename = dte["con_obj_name_for_filename"]["use_as_filename"]
if use_as_filename == "No": file_name = dte["con_obj_name_for_filename"]["file_name"] else: file_name = "DATA.csv"
_str += FOURSPACES + "File name:%s
" % file_name _str += FOURSPACES + "Use the object name for the file name?:%s
" % use_as_filename
return _str
with open(input_pipeline) as fin: lines = fin.readlines()
k, v = lines[4].strip().split(':')
module_count = int(v) new_count = module_count + 1 lines[4] = k + ":%d
" % new_count with open("output.cppipe", "w") as f: f.writelines(lines) f.write(write_etss())
f.close()

param.name: add_prefix
param.label: Add a prefix to file names?
param.option: Add prefix to the file name
Do not add prefix to the file name

param.name: filename_prefix
param.label: Enter the prefix to be added to the file names

param.name: add_metadata_column_to_object
param.label: Add image metadata columns to your object data file?
param.help: 'Image_Metadata_' columns are normally exported in the Image data file, but if you select 'Yes', they will also be exported with the Object data file(s).

param.name: represent_nan
param.label: Representation of Nan/Inf
param.help: CellProfiler will produce Inf or NaN values under certain rare circumstances, for instance when calculating the mean intensity of an object within a masked region of an image.

param.name: calc_mean
param.label: Calculate the per-image mean values for object measurements?
param.help: Select 'Yes' to calculate the population mean over all the objects in each image and save that value as an aggregate measurement in the image file.

param.name: calc_median
param.label: Calculate the per-image median values for object measurements?
param.help: Select 'Yes' to calculate the population median over all the objects in each image and save that value as an aggregate measurement in the image file.

param.name: calc_standard_deviation
param.label: Calculate the per-image standard deviation values for object measurements?
param.help: Select 'Yes' to calculate the population standard deviation over all the objects in each image and save that value as an aggregate measurement in the image file.

param.name: create_gene_pattern
param.label: Create a GenePattern GCT file?
param.help: Select 'Yes' to create a GCT file compatible with GenePattern. The GCT file format is a tab-delimited text file format designed for gene expression datasets; the specifics of the format are described here. By converting your measurements into a GCT file, you can make use of GenePatternâ€™s data visualization and clustering methods.

param.name: select_source_sample_row_name
param.label: Select source of sample row name
param.help:
The first column of the GCT file is the unique identifier for each sample, which is ordinarily the gene name. This information may be specified in one of two ways:
- Metadata: If you used the Metadata modules to add metadata to your images, you may specify a metadata tag that corresponds to the identifier for this column.
- Image filename: If the gene name is not available, the image filename can be used as a surrogate identifier.

param.name: image_filename_cat
param.label: Enter the name of the image to use as the identifier
param.help: Enter the name of the image image whose filename will be used to identify each sample row.

param.name: export_all_measurements
param.label: Export all measurement types?
param.help: Select 'Yes' to export every category of measurement. ExportToSpreadsheet will create one data file for each object produced in the pipeline, as well as per-image, per-experiment and object relationships, if relevant.

param.name: data_to_export
param.label: Data to export
param.help: This option will writ out a file of measurements for the given category.

param.name: use_as_filename
param.label: Use the object name for the file name?
param.help: Select 'Yes' to use the object name as selected above to generate a file name for the spreadsheet.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This tool will convert the measurements to a comma-, tab-, or other character-delimited text format and save them in one or several files, as requested.
@COMMON_HELP@
